Endlessly expanding technology

Presenting on Chef at next SacRuby Meetup

If you are in the Sacramento area next Thursday, come by the SacRuby Meetup! I will be presenting on using Chef for server and configuration management. I will be talking about using Chef on a large scale with a cluster of servers, all the way down to aiding management of a single server.

If you are in the area, please stop by! Pizza and refreshments are normally available.

Meetup details: http://www.meetup.com/sacruby/calendar/14122667/ Date: Thursday, August 19th Time: 7:30pm til we go home Location: 10911 White Rock Road, Rancho Cordova, CA 95670 (see details for number to call to get building access)

The main talk starts at 7:30, however we will also have a Ruby Clinic starting at 6:30. Bring your questions, problems, or other issues in and we'll try to help you out.

Friday, August 13, 2010

About

This is the personal blog of Ken Robertson. I'm a developer at Involver working in Ruby/Rails. In a former life, I worked in .NET for many years and since moved on.

In my spare time, I like to build things. I like to experiment with different technologies to find how they best fit onto my utility belt.

I sometimes blog. You'll find those things here.

I sometimes code. You'll find those on Github.
